oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Five Minute Postmortem: A Simple Approach to Field Diagnosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Guichon, P. T.
Jim, G. K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: postmortem
necropsy
instruments
tools
techniques
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Performing a thorough postmortem in the field requires following some methodical approach, ensuring that no organ system or portion of the animal is left unexamined. Few instruments or tools are required to perform a necropsy (Table 1) and the procedure should be complete in 10 - 15 minutes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1991; 155
